item.title: Pakistan: retreating market - Financial Times
item.description:
Pakistan: retreating market  Financial Times

Pakistan’s promotion from wild frontier to major emerging market index is off to a black start. Not only did stock prices fall on the day of inclusion this week but Karachi, home to the Pakistan Stock Exchange, was plunged into darkness. Both omens should be heeded, but neither should come as a surprise. Energy failures are a feature of life there while index upgrades are often followed by losses. The stock indices of the UAE and Qatar rose about one-third in the year leading up to inclusion — only to fall in the immediate aftermath. Last year, when Pakistan’s upgrade was first mooted, the ...

item.title: China investment brightens Pakistan’s future - Financial Times
item.description:
China investment brightens Pakistan’s future  Financial Times

Late last year, three Chinese exchanges jointly submitted the highest bid for a 40 per cent stake in the Pakistan Stock Exchange. They paid almost Rs9bn, or $85m. Weeks after the deal, the market hit an all-time high. This year has been a good time to be a broker in Karachi, especially after index provider MSCI announced last summer it was restoring the country to emerging market status after downgrading it to frontier status after the financial crisis. In March, local brokers with stakes in the PSX received cheques when the Chinese transaction closed. Since then, they have been sending roa...

item.title: Some Pakistani Experts See No End to Nation's Economic Slide - VOA News
item.description:
Some Pakistani Experts See No End to Nation's Economic Slide  VOA News

Pakistan's economy has been on a steady downward slide with no end in sight, some experts say, with the currency dropping, foreign exchange reserves dwindling, the trade deficit spiking and the benchmark stock index at an 18-month low. The civilian government is at odds with the powerful military, creating an uncertain political landscape that keeps investors on the sidelines. The ousted prime minister, Nawaz Sharif, is on trial for corruption, and Finance Minister Ishaq Dar has fled the country after also being charged with graft, raising questions about the prospects of turning things aro...

item.title: Pakistan economy falters over political concerns - Financial Times
item.description:
Pakistan economy falters over political concerns  Financial Times

Pakistan’s currency and stocks have been hit by sharp falls as concerns mount about the country’s political and economic difficulties. The Pakistani rupee has fallen more than 5 per cent against the US dollar in the past three days, in an apparent attempt by the finance ministry to alleviate its worsening current account deficit. Despite the weakening of the rupee, long called for by investors, stocks have also fallen, with the country’s benchmark index dropping to an 18-month low this week. Analysts said uncertainty over Pakistan’s political leadership and the stability of its economic pol...
